channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Exploring the Alignment Landscape: LLMs and Geometric Deep Models in Protein Representation
item.description: In this study, we explore the alignment of multimodal representations between LLMs and Geometric Deep Models (GDMs) in the protein domain.

item.title: DeepArUco++: Improved detection of square fiducial markers in challenging lighting conditions
item.description: Additionally, we propose a simple method for generating synthetic data for training the different models that compose the proposed pipeline, and we present a second, real-life dataset of ArUco markers in challenging lighting conditions used to evaluate our system.

item.title: FisherMask: Enhancing Neural Network Labeling Efficiency in Image Classification Using Fisher Information
item.description: FisherMask enhances batch AL by using Fisher information to select the most critical parameters, allowing the identification of the most impactful samples during AL training.

item.title: Online-LoRA: Task-free Online Continual Learning via Low Rank Adaptation
item.description: Catastrophic forgetting is a significant challenge in online continual learning (OCL), especially for non-stationary data streams that do not have well-defined task boundaries.

item.title: WorkflowLLM: Enhancing Workflow Orchestration Capability of Large Language Models
item.description: Finally, we merge the synthetic samples that pass quality confirmation with the collected samples to obtain the WorkflowBench.

item.title: SpecHub: Provable Acceleration to Multi-Draft Speculative Decoding
item.description: We present SpecHub, a novel, efficient sampling-verification method for MDSD that improves acceptance rates with only linear computational overhead.

item.title: Scaling Laws for Task-Optimized Models of the Primate Visual Ventral Stream
item.description: When trained on large-scale object classification datasets, certain artificial neural network models begin to approximate core object recognition (COR) behaviors and neural response patterns in the primate visual ventral stream (VVS).

item.title: Autoregressive Adaptive Hypergraph Transformer for Skeleton-based Activity Recognition
item.description: Extracting multiscale contextual information and higher-order correlations among skeleton sequences using Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) alone is inadequate for effective action classification.

item.title: Web Archives Metadata Generation with GPT-4o: Challenges and Insights
item.description: Current metadata creation for web archives is time consuming and costly due to reliance on human effort.

item.title: Benchmarking Distributional Alignment of Large Language Models
item.description: Language models (LMs) are increasingly used as simulacra for people, yet their ability to match the distribution of views of a specific demographic group and be \textit{distributionally aligned} remains uncertain.

item.title: Free Record-Level Privacy Risk Evaluation Through Artifact-Based Methods
item.description: Membership inference attacks (MIAs) are widely used to empirically assess the privacy risks of samples used to train a target machine learning model.

item.title: Towards Low-Resource Harmful Meme Detection with LMM Agents
item.description: The proliferation of Internet memes in the age of social media necessitates effective identification of harmful ones.

item.title: Bridging the Gap between Learning and Inference for Diffusion-Based Molecule Generation
item.description: The efficacy of diffusion models in generating a spectrum of data modalities, including images, text, and videos, has spurred inquiries into their utility in molecular generation, yielding significant advancements in the field.

item.title: Learning the rules of peptide self-assembly through data mining with large language models
item.description: Peptides are ubiquitous and important biologically derived molecules, that have been found to self-assemble to form a wide array of structures.

item.title: EUREKHA: Enhancing User Representation for Key Hackers Identification in Underground Forums
item.description: This paper presents a novel method called EUREKHA (Enhancing User Representation for Key Hacker Identification in Underground Forums), designed to identify these key hackers by modeling each user as a textual sequence.

item.title: Inversion-based Latent Bayesian Optimization
item.description: LBO learns a surrogate model to approximate the black-box objective function in the latent space.

item.title: Distributed-Order Fractional Graph Operating Network
item.description: We introduce the Distributed-order fRActional Graph Operating Network (DRAGON), a novel continuous Graph Neural Network (GNN) framework that incorporates distributed-order fractional calculus.

item.title: Multi-armed Bandits with Missing Outcome
item.description: While significant progress has been made in designing algorithms that minimize regret in online decision-making, real-world scenarios often introduce additional complexities, perhaps the most challenging of which is missing outcomes.

item.title: Revisiting Network Perturbation for Semi-Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: By revisiting network perturbations, we introduce a new approach for network perturbation to expand the existing weak-to-strong consistency regularization for unlabeled data.

item.title: Cancer-Net SCa-Synth: An Open Access Synthetically Generated 2D Skin Lesion Dataset for Skin Cancer Classification
item.description: In healthcare, generative artificial intelligence (AI) models have been employed to create synthetic data, addressing data imbalance in datasets by augmenting underrepresented classes and enhancing the overall quality and performance of machine learning models.

item.title: Unmasking the Limits of Large Language Models: A Systematic Evaluation of Masked Text Processing Ability through MskQA and MskCal
item.description: This paper sheds light on the limitations of Large Language Models (LLMs) by rigorously evaluating their ability to process masked text.

item.title: Lightning IR: Straightforward Fine-tuning and Inference of Transformer-based Language Models for Information Retrieval
item.description: A wide range of transformer-based language models have been proposed for information retrieval tasks.

item.title: IGDrivSim: A Benchmark for the Imitation Gap in Autonomous Driving
item.description: In this work, we introduce \textbf{IGDrivSim}, a benchmark built on top of the Waymax simulator, designed to investigate the effects of the imitation gap in learning autonomous driving policy from human expert demonstrations.

item.title: Thanos: Enhancing Conversational Agents with Skill-of-Mind-Infused Large Language Model
item.description: To increase social bonding with interlocutors, humans naturally acquire the ability to respond appropriately in a given situation by considering which conversational skill is most suitable for the response - a process we call skill-of-mind.

item.title: Taming Rectified Flow for Inversion and Editing
item.description: Rectified-flow-based diffusion transformers, such as FLUX and OpenSora, have demonstrated exceptional performance in the field of image and video generation.

item.title: Exploiting the Structure of Two Graphs with Graph Neural Networks
item.description: We test this in several experimental setups using synthetic and real world datasets, and observe that the proposed architecture works better than traditional deep learning architectures, showcasing the importance of leveraging the information of the two graphs.

item.title: ImpScore: A Learnable Metric For Quantifying The Implicitness Level of Language
item.description: Handling implicit language is essential for natural language processing systems to achieve precise text understanding and facilitate natural interactions with users.

item.title: Rethinking Bradley-Terry Models in Preference-Based Reward Modeling: Foundations, Theory, and Alternatives
item.description: The Bradley-Terry (BT) model is a common and successful practice in reward modeling for Large Language Model (LLM) alignment.

item.title: NeuroFly: A framework for whole-brain single neuron reconstruction
item.description: Here we introduce NeuroFly, a validated framework for large-scale automatic single neuron reconstruction.

item.title: Attention Masks Help Adversarial Attacks to Bypass Safety Detectors
item.description: Despite recent research advancements in adversarial attack methods, current approaches against XAI monitors are still discoverable and slower.

item.title: Enhancing Investment Analysis: Optimizing AI-Agent Collaboration in Financial Research
item.description: Our findings reveal significant performance variations based on the configurations of AI agents for different tasks.

item.title: Higher-Order GNNs Meet Efficiency: Sparse Sobolev Graph Neural Networks
item.description: This observation has significant implications for capturing higher-order information in GNNs for various tasks such as node classification and semi-supervised learning.

item.title: Brain Tumour Removing and Missing Modality Generation using 3D WDM
item.description: For the inpainting task of BraTS 2024, the use of a large and variable number of healthy masks and the stability and efficiency of the 3D wavelet diffusion model resulted in 0. 007, 22. 61 and 0. 842 in the validation set and 0. 07 , 22. 8 and 0. 91 in the testing set (MSE, PSNR and SSIM respectively).

item.title: Finding Strong Lottery Ticket Networks with Genetic Algorithms
item.description: According to the Strong Lottery Ticket Hypothesis, every sufficiently large neural network with randomly initialized weights contains a sub-network which - still with its random weights - already performs as well for a given task as the trained super-network.

item.title: SVDQuant: Absorbing Outliers by Low-Rank Components for 4-Bit Diffusion Models
item.description: To address this, we co-design an inference engine Nunchaku that fuses the kernels of the low-rank branch into those of the low-bit branch to cut off redundant memory access.

item.title: DomainGallery: Few-shot Domain-driven Image Generation by Attribute-centric Finetuning
item.description: The recent progress in text-to-image models pretrained on large-scale datasets has enabled us to generate various images as long as we provide a text prompt describing what we want.

item.title: Dynamic Brightness Adaptation for Robust Multi-modal Image Fusion
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose the Brightness Adaptive multimodal dynamic fusion framework (BA-Fusion), which achieves robust image fusion despite dynamic brightness fluctuations.

item.title: Field Assessment of Force Torque Sensors for Planetary Rover Navigation
item.description: Proprioceptive sensors on planetary rovers serve for state estimation and for understanding terrain and locomotion performance.

item.title: Remote Sensing-Based Assessment of Economic Development
item.description: The goal of our project is to use satellite data (including nighttime light data and remote sensing images) to give us some statistical estimation of the economic development level of a selected area (Singapore).

item.title: DELIFT: Data Efficient Language model Instruction Fine Tuning
item.description: Fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) is essential for enhancing their performance on specific tasks but is often resource-intensive due to redundant or uninformative data.

item.title: Meta-Reasoning Improves Tool Use in Large Language Models
item.description: We present Tool selECTion via meta-reasONing (TECTON), a two-phase system that first reasons over a task using a custom fine-tuned LM head and outputs candidate tools.

item.title: Conjugate gradient methods for high-dimensional GLMMs
item.description: Generalized linear mixed models (GLMMs) are a widely used tool in statistical analysis.

item.title: Variational Low-Rank Adaptation Using IVON
item.description: We replace AdamW by the Improved Variational Online Newton (IVON) algorithm to finetune large language models.

item.title: The State and Fate of Summarization Datasets
item.description: Automatic summarization has consistently attracted attention, due to its versatility and wide application in various downstream tasks.

item.title: The Impact of Semi-Supervised Learning on Line Segment Detection
item.description: In this paper we present a method for line segment detection in images, based on a semi-supervised framework.

item.title: Mining the Minoria: Unknown, Under-represented, and Under-performing Minority Groups
item.description: Specifically, we propose a minority mining problem, where we find vectors in the attribute space that reveal potential groups that are under-represented and under-performing.

item.title: Improved Multi-Task Brain Tumour Segmentation with Synthetic Data Augmentation
item.description: The use of automated tools in clinical practice has increased due to the development of more and more sophisticated and reliable algorithms.

item.title: TrajGPT: Controlled Synthetic Trajectory Generation Using a Multitask Transformer-Based Spatiotemporal Model
item.description: TrajGPT integrates the spatial and temporal models in a transformer architecture through a Bayesian probability model that ensures that the gaps in a visit sequence are filled in a spatiotemporally consistent manner.

item.title: Towards Unifying Interpretability and Control: Evaluation via Intervention
item.description: We introduce two new evaluation metrics: intervention success rate and the coherence-intervention tradeoff, designed to measure the accuracy of explanations and their utility in controlling model behavior.

item.title: Social EgoMesh Estimation
item.description: Accurately estimating the 3D pose of the camera wearer in egocentric video sequences is crucial to modeling human behavior in virtual and augmented reality applications.
